Detailed Description

Obtains an ObtainableObject and destructs it when necessary. An object-obtainer does a reference-counting, hence when all object-obtainers are destructed and the object-obtainer has been initialized to obtain a disposable obtainable-object, the obtainable-object itself will get deleted too.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ObjectObtainer::ObjectObtainer (   ) 
 

ObjectObtainer::ObjectObtainer (  ObtainableObject *  object,
BOOLEAN  disposable,
UINT8  object_hint = 0
) 
 

Parameters:
object Pointer to the obtainable-object, which may be shared.
disposable If set to TRUE, the obtainable-object object will get deleted automatically, when no object-obtainer references this obtainable-object anymore.
object_hint Sets a hint for the object (see ObjectObtainer::GetObjectHint for details).

ObtainableObject* ObjectObtainer::GetObject (   )  [inline]
 

UINT ObjectObtainer::GetObjectHint (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the object-hint which can be assigned when constructing an ObjectObtainer. The object-hint allows derived classes to add e. g. a runtime type information of the passed object for a dynamic cast.
